subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The '470 mod?
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Frank, Thanks for the extra instructions, it doesn't sound too  
difficult for me so I'll give it a shot.

By the way, I did listen to your tone control clip. Since I'm new to  
this my comments are probably not "worth" much at this point. I  
thought the entire clip itself was a lot smoother and clearer than  
most I've heard so far from various sources (the mixed station sounds  
are in smaller pieces so for someone like me it would be easier to  
pick out the EVPs as opposed to entire words from radio announcers).  
The short piece about 2/3 of the way through, where I'm guessing you  
used a clarifier, sounded muffled to me, which makes me think it would  
also muffle the EVPs. Definitely easier on the ears but for someone  
inexperienced (and I seem to be the only one here!) it seems it would  
be harder to pick out the real words too.

By the way, in listening to the deluge of clips uploaded last night, I  
can't help but notice that the voices are all men. Just curious -- is  
that always the case?
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Debbie Tejada

"Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert  
Einstein

On Jan 2, 2008, at 10:22 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:

>  I have the '470, but I don't know if it's the older one or not. I  
> was able to modify it, but it was somewhat different than in the  
> video instruction, there was more than one green wire. You have to  
> lift the top board so you can see the wire connections on the other  
> board, they are labeled, and you can tell what wire to cut/ 
> unsolder.  (mute wire).
>
>  Frank-S
>
>
>
>
> Share life as it happens with the new Windows Live. Share now!
>
